alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 21 at 10:49PM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous wind chills expected, along with periods of light snowfall. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Southern Nebraska Panhandle, including the cites of Sidney and Brownson. * WHEN...5 PM MST this evening through 11 AM MST Thursday February 24th. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in less than 10 minutes. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. In addition, some roadways may become slick or snow covered where heavier snow falls.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
